alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Spartanburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 26 at 8:23PM EDT until June 26 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Rutherford County in western North Carolina... Southwestern Cleveland County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Northeastern Spartanburg County in Upstate South Carolina... Western Cherokee County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 915 PM EDT. * At 823 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles south of Forest City, or near Chesnee, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Gaffney, Cowpens, Mayo, Chesnee, Cowpens National Battlefield, Cliffside, Draytonville, Thicketty, Henrietta and Harris. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
